DS.content: Hymen: <small>INTER </small>Platonem et Mallarmatum [p. 219n btwn Mallarmé & Hegel]
DS.linkedContent: Hymen: INTER Platonem et Mallarmatum [p. 219n btwn Mallarmé & Hegel]

DS.content: the hystera is supposed to be “behind” the hymen, but it exposes itself only through mimicry, transference & simulacrum
DS.linkedContent: the hystera is supposed to be “behind” the hymen, but it exposes itself only through mimicry, transference & simulacrum

DS.content: perfect crime (mimed doubly), orgasm, heights of jouissance > leave no trace, (Bataille's laughing at dying, dying of laughter), “supreme spasm” [Wolf Man] > hymen
DS.linkedContent: perfect crime (mimed doubly), orgasm, heights of jouissance > leave no trace, (Bataille's laughing at dying, dying of laughter), “supreme spasm” [Wolf Man] > hymen

DS.content: masturbatory suicide
DS.linkedContent: masturbatory suicide

DS.content: out of sight (a perte de vue): hymen & dissemination > une entaille y est marquée, qui ouvre encore sur un autre texte et pratique une autre lecture, l’analyse en serait infinie
DS.linkedContent: out of sight (a perte de vue): hymen & dissemination > une entaille y est marquée, qui ouvre encore sur un autre texte et pratique une autre lecture, l’analyse en serait infinie

DS.content: deconstruction’s ceaseless dissymmetry (i.e. what Hyppolite calls Mallarmé’s “materialism of the idea”) works alongside possibility of deconstruction’s neutralizing moment, the “logic of the hymen” is neither negatively neutral, nor neutral at all
DS.linkedContent: deconstruction’s ceaseless dissymmetry (i.e. what Hyppolite calls Mallarmé’s “materialism of the idea”) works alongside possibility of deconstruction’s neutralizing moment, the “logic of the hymen” is neither negatively neutral, nor neutral at all

DS.content: space of writing: “event” in which nothing happens—hymen, crime, suicide, spasm (laughter/pleasure): everything describes structure of text & effectuates its possibility > a lustre which is nothing beyond its own fragmented light
DS.linkedContent: space of writing: “event” in which nothing happens—hymen, crime, suicide, spasm (laughter/pleasure): everything describes structure of text & effectuates its possibility > a lustre which is nothing beyond its own fragmented light

DS.content: for Mallarmé, ideality of idea, metaphysical name, is necessary to mark non-being, nonpresent, marks w/out breaking glass, alludes to epekeina tēs ousias: a hymen (closeness & veil) btwn Plato’s sun & Mallarmé’s lustre
DS.linkedContent: for Mallarmé, ideality of idea, metaphysical name, is necessary to mark non-being, nonpresent, marks w/out breaking glass, alludes to epekeina tēs ousias: a hymen (closeness & veil) btwn Plato’s sun & Mallarmé’s lustre

DS.content: hymen (hymn): supreme spasm, sign of fusion, consummation, marriage, confusion or identification of two > nonpresence, gaping void of desire, & presence, fullness, satisfaction—now amount to same: yet there is not a single term, no fullness of the signified, it’s the difference that no longer functions (btwn empty signifier/full signified, image/thing)
DS.linkedContent: hymen (hymn): supreme spasm, sign of fusion, consummation, marriage, confusion or identification of two > nonpresence, gaping void of desire, & presence, fullness, satisfaction—now amount to same: yet there is not a single term, no fullness of the signified, it’s the difference that no longer functions (btwn empty signifier/full signified, image/thing)

DS.content: no more spatial heterogeneity of 2 poles: l’accomplissement se résume dans le désir, le désir est (en avance sur) l’accomplissement qui demeure, toujours mimé, un désir, “sans briser la glace”
DS.linkedContent: no more spatial heterogeneity of 2 poles: l’accomplissement se résume dans le désir, le désir est (en avance sur) l’accomplissement qui demeure, toujours mimé, un désir, “sans briser la glace”

DS.content: temporal dislocation in hymen baffles decidability of different terms: is there even time, tenses, temporal differences, when there’s no central present/referent?
DS.linkedContent: temporal dislocation in hymen baffles decidability of different terms: is there even time, tenses, temporal differences, when there’s no central present/referent?

DS.content: rhythm as hymen (Dream?), “center of vibratory suspense”: soir, noir, noire, miroir, ivoire
DS.linkedContent: rhythm as hymen (Dream?), “center of vibratory suspense”: soir, noir, noire, miroir, ivoire

DS.content: hymen as medium, as btwn, takes place in spacing btwn desire/fulfillment (indifferent to opposites)—not a center; interval, cave (antre), entre; space btwn 2 palisades (palisade always “full”)
DS.linkedContent: hymen as medium, as btwn, takes place in spacing btwn desire/fulfillment (indifferent to opposites)—not a center; interval, cave (antre), entre; space btwn 2 palisades (palisade always “full”)

DS.content: “hymen (out of which flows Dream), tainted w/ vice yet sacred”
DS.linkedContent: “hymen (out of which flows Dream), tainted w/ vice yet sacred”

DS.content: hymen as invisible veil, vaginal partition btwn inside/outside of woman
DS.linkedContent: hymen as invisible veil, vaginal partition btwn inside/outside of woman

DS.content: if love or murder takes place, there’s no hymen; also, takes place when nothing happens, when there’s an all consuming consummation w/out violence, or a violence w/out blows/marks > die or come laughing
DS.linkedContent: if love or murder takes place, there’s no hymen; also, takes place when nothing happens, when there’s an all consuming consummation w/out violence, or a violence w/out blows/marks > die or come laughing

DS.content: hymenoptera, filmy membrane, uphainō (to weave, spin spider web), huphos (textile), humnos (a weave, wedding song, song of mourning), suo, suere (to sew), a little stitch (syuman), tissue on which so many bodily metaphors are written
DS.linkedContent: hymenoptera, filmy membrane, uphainō (to weave, spin spider web), huphos (textile), humnos (a weave, wedding song, song of mourning), suo, suere (to sew), a little stitch (syuman), tissue on which so many bodily metaphors are written

DS.content: hymen: “a medium, pure medium, of fiction,” “btwn perpetration and remembrance,” memory of a crime never committed > penetrate, perpetrate the hymen, fictively, “solitary captive of the threshold”
DS.linkedContent: hymen: “a medium, pure medium, of fiction,” “btwn perpetration and remembrance,” memory of a crime never committed > penetrate, perpetrate the hymen, fictively, “solitary captive of the threshold”

DS.content: at the edge of being (au bord de l’être): the entre of the hymen, masked gap, veil of virginity (where nothing’s taken place) & consummation, penetration of antre, release [one in the other] > mirror never passed through, ice never broke, at the edge of being
DS.linkedContent: at the edge of being (au bord de l’être): the entre of the hymen, masked gap, veil of virginity (where nothing’s taken place) & consummation, penetration of antre, release [one in the other] > mirror never passed through, ice never broke, at the edge of being

DS.content: hymen, comme tissu, envelops, outwits (déjoue) philosphemes, ontologies, dialectics, les retourne et les inscrit, suspense in the antre of perpenetration
DS.linkedContent: hymen, comme tissu, envelops, outwits (déjoue) philosphemes, ontologies, dialectics, les retourne et les inscrit, suspense in the antre of perpenetration

DS.content: play of commas (virgulae) inserts cuts, spacing, shortness of breath w/in continuum of sequence > hymen in perpetual motion, can’t get out of Mallarmé’s cave like you can Plato’s
DS.linkedContent: play of commas (virgulae) inserts cuts, spacing, shortness of breath w/in continuum of sequence > hymen in perpetual motion, can’t get out of Mallarmé’s cave like you can Plato’s

DS.content: play of hymen at once vicious & sacred; nothing more perverse than rending penetration that leaves virgin womb in tact
DS.linkedContent: play of hymen at once vicious & sacred; nothing more perverse than rending penetration that leaves virgin womb in tact

DS.content: mimēsis of present referent gets lost in the hymen, lost presence, lost absolute knowledge
DS.linkedContent: mimēsis of present referent gets lost in the hymen, lost presence, lost absolute knowledge

DS.content: Derrida not using hymen like Hegel used Aufhebung, Urteil (contradictory layers of signification, depth); what counts for hymen is form or syntactical praxis that (de)composes it
DS.linkedContent: Derrida not using hymen like Hegel used Aufhebung, Urteil (contradictory layers of signification, depth); what counts for hymen is form or syntactical praxis that (de)composes it

DS.content: the word hymen could be lost, and its function would remain: we’ve been making believe everything can be traced to this name [see GOD p. 116], simply possesses a certain economic condensation, accumulation
DS.linkedContent: the word hymen could be lost, and its function would remain: we’ve been making believe everything can be traced to this name [see GOD p. 116], simply possesses a certain economic condensation, accumulation

DS.content: through “hymen” one marks what entre already marks, could replace w/ “identity,” “marriage,” “crime,” “difference”
DS.linkedContent: through “hymen” one marks what entre already marks, could replace w/ “identity,” “marriage,” “crime,” “difference”

DS.content: hymen in text (crime, sexual act, incest, suicide, simulacrum) inscribed at very tip (à la pointe) of indecision
DS.linkedContent: hymen in text (crime, sexual act, incest, suicide, simulacrum) inscribed at very tip (à la pointe) of indecision

DS.content: hymen in relation to inter-, “btwn,” a syncategorem, syntactical plug, even Husserl calls this an incomplete signification, its syntactical (de)composition can never be mastered
DS.linkedContent: hymen in relation to inter-, “btwn,” a syncategorem, syntactical plug, even Husserl calls this an incomplete signification, its syntactical (de)composition can never be mastered

DS.content: like Freud’s unconscious (syntax of “hymen” tolerates, remains insensitive, to contradiction)
DS.linkedContent: like Freud’s unconscious (syntax of “hymen” tolerates, remains insensitive, to contradiction)

DS.content: mime is both read & reading, written & writing, btwn the 2, in the suspense of the hymen, at once screen & mirror
DS.linkedContent: mime is both read & reading, written & writing, btwn the 2, in the suspense of the hymen, at once screen & mirror

DS.content: simple opposition btwn activity & passivity (btwn all -er/-ed concepts) becomes too formally weak to encompass graphics of hymen, its spider web, the play of its eyelids
DS.linkedContent: simple opposition btwn activity & passivity (btwn all -er/-ed concepts) becomes too formally weak to encompass graphics of hymen, its spider web, the play of its eyelids

DS.content: necessity of folding (page of the hymen) not a secondary procedure, no smooth fold, hymen doesn’t simply adopt some fold > fold, in the lining which, of itself, the hymen was, at once its outside and its inside, no proper name, doesn’t exist: hymen, already torn, in the fold
DS.linkedContent: necessity of folding (page of the hymen) not a secondary procedure, no smooth fold, hymen doesn’t simply adopt some fold > fold, in the lining which, of itself, the hymen was, at once its outside and its inside, no proper name, doesn’t exist: hymen, already torn, in the fold

DS.content: le pli (se) multiplie mais (n’est) pas (un)
DS.linkedContent: le pli (se) multiplie mais (n’est) pas (un)

DS.content: in the morgue you’ve been able to read the folding (vous aurez pu lire que la pliure)
DS.linkedContent: in the morgue you’ve been able to read the folding (vous aurez pu lire que la pliure)

DS.content: intermission or interim of hymen does not establish time [Setareh] > non-mastery, no present in truth presents itself there
DS.linkedContent: intermission or interim of hymen does not establish time [Setareh] > non-mastery, no present in truth presents itself there

DS.content: critical desire, philosophical desire, tries to regain mastery, reads hymen acc. this or that species of presence
DS.linkedContent: critical desire, philosophical desire, tries to regain mastery, reads hymen acc. this or that species of presence

DS.content: syntax of hymen’s fold makes it impossible to arrest its play of indecision [i.e. to stop it on “mental,” or “imaginary”]
DS.linkedContent: syntax of hymen’s fold makes it impossible to arrest its play of indecision [i.e. to stop it on “mental,” or “imaginary”]

DS.content: hymen, verra, vers [O p. 25 crisis of versus]
DS.linkedContent: hymen, verra, vers [O p. 25 crisis of versus]

DS.content: Jean-Pierre Richard: beauty of glorious lie is what art tries to render true, to do so, must put it under glass
DS.linkedContent: Jean-Pierre Richard: beauty of glorious lie is what art tries to render true, to do so, must put it under glass

DS.content: “fiction,” “hymen,” “spacious” are caught in, while disrupting, ontological machine
DS.linkedContent: “fiction,” “hymen,” “spacious” are caught in, while disrupting, ontological machine

DS.content: Mallarmé’s i: a slash that never cuts its wing, penna (feather pen), needles and scratches; hymen fastens down, tears, crinkles and folds the Crise de vers [m/f]
DS.linkedContent: Mallarmé’s i: a slash that never cuts its wing, penna (feather pen), needles and scratches; hymen fastens down, tears, crinkles and folds the Crise de vers [m/f]

DS.content: Mallarmé: passing butterfly leaves a bit of sharp ingenuous nothing [about to break through hymen]
DS.linkedContent: Mallarmé: passing butterfly leaves a bit of sharp ingenuous nothing [about to break through hymen]

DS.content: [Derrida quotes Mallarmé, says nowhere have the graphics of hymen been more strongly stressed]
DS.linkedContent: [Derrida quotes Mallarmé, says nowhere have the graphics of hymen been more strongly stressed]

DS.content: forms of writing subject to law of hymen (literature, theater, drama, ballet, dance, fable, mimicry), the rule of the cast-aside-reference, the being aside (référence écartée, être à l’écart)
DS.linkedContent: forms of writing subject to law of hymen (literature, theater, drama, ballet, dance, fable, mimicry), the rule of the cast-aside-reference, the being aside (référence écartée, être à l’écart)

DS.content: hymen as the double show, as the difference between the sexes, play of penna (bird, wing, feather, quill, beak, etc.), and process of metaphorical reproduction constantly being relaunched by gap, setting-aside, of being
DS.linkedContent: hymen as the double show, as the difference between the sexes, play of penna (bird, wing, feather, quill, beak, etc.), and process of metaphorical reproduction constantly being relaunched by gap, setting-aside, of being

DS.content: Aufhebung—most “relevant” way of (re)covering (up) graphics of supplementarity or hymen, le recouvrement le plus séduisant, because most similar > thus, must critique Aufhebung as decisive target, that which obfuscates specificity of “writing operation”
DS.linkedContent: Aufhebung—most “relevant” way of (re)covering (up) graphics of supplementarity or hymen, le recouvrement le plus séduisant, because most similar > thus, must critique Aufhebung as decisive target, that which obfuscates specificity of “writing operation”

DS.content: dialectical structure can’t account for graphics of hymen, is itself comprehended and inscribed w/in latter, separated from it only by itself, a simple veil that constitutes the very thing that tries to reduce it to nothing: desire
DS.linkedContent: dialectical structure can’t account for graphics of hymen, is itself comprehended and inscribed w/in latter, separated from it only by itself, a simple veil that constitutes the very thing that tries to reduce it to nothing: desire

DS.content: blank as polysemic totality of whiteness plus the fanlike form of text (spaced-out splitting of whole), plus the writing site (hymen), no longer determinate signifier or signifier at all
DS.linkedContent: blank as polysemic totality of whiteness plus the fanlike form of text (spaced-out splitting of whole), plus the writing site (hymen), no longer determinate signifier or signifier at all

DS.content: paper & hymen: blankness that allows for fold > forever re-marks itself as disappearance, erasure, non-sense
DS.linkedContent: paper & hymen: blankness that allows for fold > forever re-marks itself as disappearance, erasure, non-sense

DS.content: virginity (newness, wholeness) always overlaid w/ opposite—virginity submits to operation of hymen of its own accord
DS.linkedContent: virginity (newness, wholeness) always overlaid w/ opposite—virginity submits to operation of hymen of its own accord

DS.content: “the masculine is turned back on the feminine: whole adventure of sexual difference” > in same blow: fold ruptures virginity it marks as virginity, folding over its secret > nothing more virginal (and at same time) more purloined/penetrated than secret (loses smooth simplicity of its surface)
DS.linkedContent: “the masculine is turned back on the feminine: whole adventure of sexual difference” > in same blow: fold ruptures virginity it marks as virginity, folding over its secret > nothing more virginal (and at same time) more purloined/penetrated than secret (loses smooth simplicity of its surface)

DS.content: secret differs before letter opener separates lips of the book, divided from/by itself, like hymen > after the fact, it remains what it was, virgin
DS.linkedContent: secret differs before letter opener separates lips of the book, divided from/by itself, like hymen > after the fact, it remains what it was, virgin

DS.content: hymen, not truth of unveiling: no alētheia, only wink of hymen: rhythmic fall, regular (w)inclined cadence (une cadence inclinée)
DS.linkedContent: hymen, not truth of unveiling: no alētheia, only wink of hymen: rhythmic fall, regular (w)inclined cadence (une cadence inclinée)

DS.content: if hymen constitutes itself as textual trace, if it always leaves something behind, it’s because its undecidability cuts it off from depending on any signified
DS.linkedContent: if hymen constitutes itself as textual trace, if it always leaves something behind, it’s because its undecidability cuts it off from depending on any signified

DS.content: hymen, one of those “beneficent figures” engendered by “the opposition btwn the closed and the open”: i.e. the fan, the book, the dancer
DS.linkedContent: hymen, one of those “beneficent figures” engendered by “the opposition btwn the closed and the open”: i.e. the fan, the book, the dancer

DS.content: hymen is the structure of and/or, btwn and and or
DS.linkedContent: hymen is the structure of and/or, btwn and and or

DS.content: hymen not even a signifier or sign [an event?], thus everything that comes from propagation-structure of hymen, i.e. text, is never truly made up of “signs” or “signifiers”
DS.linkedContent: hymen not even a signifier or sign [an event?], thus everything that comes from propagation-structure of hymen, i.e. text, is never truly made up of “signs” or “signifiers”

DS.content: supplementary addition [addiction] enriches itself w/ zeros > racing toward infinity: “more” and “less” are separated/united by next-to-nothing of the hymen
DS.linkedContent: supplementary addition [addiction] enriches itself w/ zeros > racing toward infinity: “more” and “less” are separated/united by next-to-nothing of the hymen

DS.content: hymen is not a phenomenon—it folds itself back into the antre, which is an abyss
DS.linkedContent: hymen is not a phenomenon—it folds itself back into the antre, which is an abyss

DS.content: mark upon mark, text w/in text, margin in mark (endless repeat): an abyss
DS.linkedContent: mark upon mark, text w/in text, margin in mark (endless repeat): an abyss

DS.content: writing en abyme, abyss will never have glint (l’éclat) of phenomenon > becomes white or black, l’un et/ou l’autre au carré de l’écriture
DS.linkedContent: writing en abyme, abyss will never have glint (l’éclat) of phenomenon > becomes white or black, l’un et/ou l’autre au carré de l’écriture

DS.content: hymen will have always disseminated: SPERM, burning lava, milk, spume, dribble of seminal liquor
DS.linkedContent: hymen will have always disseminated: SPERM, burning lava, milk, spume, dribble of seminal liquor

DS.content: dissemination, fold of hymen, somber white of cave or womb, au noir sur blanc du ventre, lieu de son émission éparse et de ses hasards sans retours [scattered emissions, chances, w/out return]
DS.linkedContent: dissemination, fold of hymen, somber white of cave or womb, au noir sur blanc du ventre, lieu de son émission éparse et de ses hasards sans retours [scattered emissions, chances, w/out return]

DS.content: dissemination in the folds of the hymen
DS.linkedContent: dissemination in the folds of the hymen

DS.content: difference  is the necessary interval, suspense btwn 2 outcomes, “lapse of time” btwn 2 shots, rolls, chances > a game of chance forever new, a play of fire forever young > fire & games (via Nietzsche, Heraclitus), play of luck w/ necessity: a hymen btwn chance & rule

DS.content: exhausted library protected by pane of glass (verre) (by fortunes of a verse (vers) or hymen) > pane of glass serves as insulator & contact btwn library & turmoil [TACT]
DS.linkedContent: exhausted library protected by pane of glass (verre) (by fortunes of a verse (vers) or hymen) > pane of glass serves as insulator & contact btwn library & turmoil [TACT]

DS.content: missing the V of the hymen; verses
DS.linkedContent: missing the V of the hymen; verses

DS.content: [re: Les Mots anglais] French grafted onto English—born of an “indissoluble hymen”
DS.linkedContent: [re: Les Mots anglais] French grafted onto English—born of an “indissoluble hymen”

DS.content: M (at once male/maternal) as upside-down double V
DS.linkedContent: M (at once male/maternal) as upside-down double V

DS.content: roll die in hymen, write, seminal spurt: hasard selon le programme génétique > limited to 6 surfaces [each guarding chance]
